Nearly 100 years after women fought for and earned the right to vote, most Americans are shocked to realize that the U.S. Constitution does not already guarantee women the same rights and protections as men. It’s long past time for us to correct this injustice. #eranow

It’s an historic day in the House of Represetatives w/the 1st hearing on the #ERAnow in 36 years. Women should not have to wait any longer to see equality enshrined in our Constitution. To those who think it’s already there, sorry, but it is not. Let’s change that this Congress.

Four years later, Baltimore still mourns the death of Freddie Gray. His death sparked a personal awakening for Baltimore and added to a natl conversation on race, policing, poverty in cities across America, access to quality education, and the scarcity of safe/affordable housing.

The American public deserves to read the #MuellerReport for themselves and hear directly from Special Counsel Mueller in testimony before Congress. 

Let me know your thoughts. How should Congress follow up on the  #MuellerReport ?  https://www.justice.gov/storage/report.pdf …

The #MuellerReport is a fresh starting point and far from ‘game over.’ We must work to prevent future attacks on our country and stem abuses of power. Mueller has given us a roadmap for continuing investigations. The report makes it clear that the ball is back in Congress’ hands.
Attorney General Barr’s need to insert his own spin regarding the president and the investigation were gratuitous and unnecessary. He has lost credibility as the people’s attorney.

In addition to voluminous details of attempts to obstruct justice, here is what the #MuellerReport says: “… if we had confidence after a thorough investigation of the facts that the President clearly did not commit obstruction of justice, we would so state.” (Vol II, Page 2)
Anyone who responds to the #MuellerReport saying that there were no attempts to obstruct justice has not read this report.
“The Trump campaign expected it would benefit electorally from information stolen and released through Russian efforts.” (Vol I, p.5)

Still reading through the #MuellerReport but what I have read should worry all Americans. 

“The Russian government interfered in the 2016 presidential election in sweeping and systemic fashion.” (Vol. I, p.1)

 https://www.justice.gov/storage/report.pdf …
Reading through the #MuellerReport now. His words are speaking volumes but we also need to hear from him directly.  Robert Mueller should testify before the House and Senate soon.

Congress -- House and Senate -- have oversight responsibilities that must be taken seriously. We have an obligation to protect our country from Russia and others who would want to do us harm, including trying to twist our system for their own purposes.

The #MuellerReport is now public. I'm reading it. More importantly, the American people should read the report for themselves and draw their own conclusions.  https://www.justice.gov/storage/report.pdf …
After nearly two years of investigations into how our country was attacked by Russians, the American public deserves to hear from Robert Mueller. We don't need more spin from AG Barr. #MuellerReport
This is why we fought to elevate the National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities -- to focus research on best ways to improve minority health.    @NIMHD

Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders are 30% more likely to be diagnosed with cancer than non-Hispanic Whites. 

Asian Americans accounted for 30% of chronic Hepatitis B cases, whereas non-Hispanic Whites only accounted for 13.5 percent of cases.

African-American men are 60% more likely to die from a stroke than non-Hispanic White men.

Hispanics have higher rates of end-stage renal disease caused by diabetes, and are 30 percent more likely to die of diabetes, than non-Hispanic Whites.

It is simply unjust that different racial groups face starkly different health outcomes. African-American women were as likely to have been diagnosed w/breast cancer as non-Hispanic white women, but African-American women were almost 41% more likely to die  (2011-15 stats).

April is #MinorityHealthMonth. Proud to lead w/ @SenatorTimScott a bipartisan group recognizing the need to improve health outcomes and reduce health disparities. Addressing inequities in health care access and outcomes must be one of our highest priorities.

The Violence Against Women Act has a proud and bipartisan history.  VAWA enhanced investigations and prosecutions of sex offenses, and created a number of new grant programs that included law enforcement, public and private entities, services providers, and victims of crime.
These victims need to know that they have our support, including access to justice, help with housing, medical care, and economic opportunity #VAWA

It’s time for @SenateMajLdr McConnell to bring the House-passed Violence Against Women Act up for a vote without delay. Saving women’s lives should not be a partisan issue.  The statistics of domestic violence are alarming, yet domestic violence crimes remain under-reported ...

Unfortunately, it is clear that Secretary Bernhardt will continue down the dangerous path set out by his predecessor to needlessly open up the Atlantic and other sensitive habitats to such activity in furtherance of President Trump’s so-called ‘energy dominance’ order.

I opposed David Bernhardt’s nomination because I oppose all drilling off the Atlantic Coast, which contains some of the most pristine coastlines in America. Our region is very much aware of how fragile the #ChesapeakeBay is and what would be in jeopardy from an oil spill.

The Democracy Restoration Act would right a wrong in our society. Over 6 million minorities - 1 of every 13 African Americans — is denied the right to vote because of a past conviction. Thankfully, 16 states have taken steps to restore voting rights but we must act nationally. pic.twitter.com/6Hf3KMI8hq

Casting a vote is one of the most fundamental rights in a democracy and gives you a say in the future of your community. Congress has a responsibility to ensure that right is protected. It’s simply wrong that states can permanently deny citizens participation in society.
Introduced today, the Democracy Restoration Act (S. 1068) would eliminate the current patchwork of rights and create a nationwide standard that facilitates voting rights for returning citizens.

Starting soon, we will be talking live about how states across the country are moving to ensure the right of all citizens to vote, regardless of their criminal history. http://www.youtube.com/user/senatorcardin/live …

Trending right now, #AvengersEndgame is only slightly higher than #EqualPayDay ... In real life, we can make a real difference in the lives of women and families across America by finally passing the #PaycheckFairnessAct and making the #paygap vanish.

The Trump DOJ’s decision to destroy the ACA puts millions of Americans, especially those with pre-existing conditions, at risk. I strongly agree with @SenatorShaheen who said that Republicans must start defending their constituents instead of their President. #ProtectOurCare

The efforts of the Trump DOJ to repeal ACA and protections of Americans w/ pre-existing conditions is nothing short of an assault on the American public. Health care is a human right; not another line on a list of empty campaign promises. #ProtectOurCare https://www.healthline.com/health-news/what-to-know-about-pre-existing-conditions-with-aca-in-danger#Higher-out-of-pocket-costs …

The Republican “plan” for health care puts millions of Americans risk. On #WorldAutismDay we recognize the need to support Americans w/ pre-existing conditions to receive the care they deserve under a health care system that represents the values of this nation. #ProtectOurCare

There is no logical reason that men and women are paid different wages for the same work. Congress can work to close the #paygap #EqualPayDay https://thekojonnamdishow.org/shows/2019-04-02/what-the-gender-pay-gap-looks-like-in-the-washington-region …

Maryland women are making $0.86 cents for every dollar a man earns. If the gender wage gap were closed in MD, and in states around the country, it would cut the poverty rate for working women in half and add nearly a half trillion dollars to our economy. https://www.aauw.org/resource/gender-pay-gap-by-state-and-congressional-district/ …

How a nation treats its women – economically and socially—is a sign of that nation’s success. The wage disparity between American men and women is hurting our nation. The Senate must take up and pass the Paycheck Fairness Act. #EqualPayDay

It supports programs to fight gangs and drug trafficking. It combats corruption. It creates educational and economic opportunities that benefit both the U.S. and local economies. Most of this assistance supports the work of non-profit and faith-based organizations.

This assistance enjoys widespread, bipartisan support because it directly fights the instability that drives people to leave their homes in the first place. Contrary to the Trump Administration’s rhetoric, foreign assistance is not a handout to foreign govts. #CentralAmerica

The decision to stop foreign assistance to Central America actively undermines the security interests of the United States. It is reckless and counterproductive. https://www.cardin.senate.gov/newsroom/press/release/cardin-calls-trump-move-to-cut-off-aid-to-central-american-countries-reckless-and-counterproductive …
